result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.08, <0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.08, <0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Echoe R Waterhouse was found guilty of OWI (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. Enclosed is an assessment information sheet and a referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Echoe R Waterhouse

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 2:09 PM Defendant Echoe R Waterhouse in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Echoe R Waterhouse.  Attorney Brian H. Wright  in court for State of Wisconsin.  .125 BAC. State puts agreement on the record and requests to remove minor child as passenger from count 1.   Court amends count 1 to remove minor child as passenger.  DE pleads guilty to amended count 1.  Court accepts plea, finds guilty, and orders $811.50 forfeiture to be paid in 60 days, AODA, and 6 month DL revocation.  State moves to dismiss count 3.  Court dismisses count 3.

10:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Echoe R Waterhouse appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Echoe R Waterhouse. Attorney Rockow requests reset.  State does not object.  Plea date set.  Address updated and phone number confirmed.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Echoe R Waterhouse
Current: 918 1st Ave, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2022)
Prior: 419 Schofield Street, Chetek, WI 54728

DE appears in person for additional case that had not been referred by RLPD.  Dustin Rockow appeared by video.  Brian Wright appears in person.  DE relates regarding citation BF973492-2.  State relates and confirms with courts that citation had not been referred to the courts or DA.  Court relates.  Attorney Rockow relates and requests new case to track with 22CM08.  NGPs are entered in 22CM08 & new case once filed.  Both cases set for 6/29/2022 at 10:00 AM before judge Boyle.

**NOTE: 04/04/22 Per Discussion with the DA's office there was a little confusion and another case will NOT be filed.  22CM8 is the only file***

10:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Julie L Matucheski appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Echoe R Waterhouse appeared by video, Attorney Michael Steuer appeared by video for Echoe R Waterhouse. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives further reading.  NG plea entered.
Status hearing set; may be by zoom
Bond to continue.
Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
MUST SIGN BOND BEFORE 4:00 P.M. TODAY, FEBRUARY 15, 2022.

11:05 AM Defendant Echoe R Waterhouse appeared by video, Attorney John A Rafa Todd appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.  Case to be recalled.  11:22 a.m. Back on the record.  Defendant qualifies and will not be hiring her own counsel and will stay with the public defenders office.  Address confirmed and phone number updated. AIA set.  Bond set.  Hearing set and may appear by Zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Setting for same date/time as AIA for co-Defendant per discussion with DA's office.  They will send a Summons.
